intro: Haworthia pectinis, commonly known as the Zebra Haworthia, is a species of flowering plant in the Asphodelaceae family. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its compact rosette of fleshy, blue-green leaves with distinctive white or yellow markings. The leaves are thick and succulent, adapted to store water in arid environments. It produces small, white, tubular flowers on slender stalks during the summer months. This plant is popular among succulent enthusiasts due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
